title: Antichamber Launch Trailer - January 31st, 2013 on Steam
description:
Steam Page: http://store.steampowered.com/app/219890
Official Website: http://www.antichamber-game.com
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/Antichamber
Twitter: http://twitter.com/Antichamber

Antichamber is a mind-bending psychological exploration game where nothing can be taken for granted. Discover an Escher-like world where hallways wrap around upon each other, spaces reconfigure themselves, and accomplishing the impossible may just be the only way forward.

Several years in the making, Antichamber received over 25 awards and honors throughout its development, in major competitions including the Independent Games Festival, the PAX10, IndieCade and Make Something Unreal. Antichamber was also supported by the Indie Fund.

Key Features: 
- A deeply psychological experience that will make you question everything you know about how a game works.
- Mind-bending challenges that will subvert your expectations at every twist and turn.
- An enormous, seamless non-Euclidean world to explore.
- Lifelike soundscapes developed by Robin Arnott and an ambient soundtrack composed by Siddhartha Barnhoorn.
- A gun that can create, destroy and manipulate matter, allowing you to discover new ways to overcome your surroundings.

System Requirements:
OS:Windows XP SP2, Vista, or Windows 7
Processor:2.0+ GHz or better (dual core recommended)
Memory:2 GB RAM
Graphics:NVIDIA 8000 series or higher (Shader Model 3 Compatible)
DirectX®:9.0c
Hard Drive:1 GB HD space

title: Antichamber - Review
description:
First-person puzzling gets trippy and esoteric in the non-Euclidian sense!

http://www.gametrailers.com/games/qz7l5g/antichamber

http://antichamber-game.com

Antichamber
Developer: Alexander Bruce
Release Date: January 31, 2013
Genre: Adventure, Indie, Puzzle
Platforms: PC

ESRB Content Rating: Not Rated

title: Antichamber: An Overnight Success, Seven Years In The Making
description: When Antichamber was released at the beginning of 2013, it became an instant critical and financial success, but the journey to getting there was as much of a psychological challenge as the game itself. In this talk, Alexander Bruce looks back at the entire history of the game, as he went from working alone in a bedroom to flying around the world and landing on the IGF stage in 2012.

title: Antichamber: Three Years of Hardcore Iteration
description:
Antichamber was originally released as a mod for Unreal Tournament 3 in 2009. The core puzzles, mechanics and base themes were all in place. But what worked as a free mod had some serious issues when making the transition to a standalone commercial game. This GDC 2014 Main Conference talk from the game's creator Alex Bruce lays out an in-depth analysis of the several years of refinement that went into turning an abstract experiment into an independent hit.
GDC talks cover a range of developmental topics including game design, programming, audio, visual arts, business management, production, online games, and much more. We post a fresh GDC video every weekday.  Subscribe to the channel to stay on top of regular updates, and check out GDC Vault  for thousands of more in-depth talks from our archives.

Follow us on Twitter
https://twitter.com/Official_GDC

Checkout our Facebook page for GDC exclusives
https://www.facebook.com/GameDevelopersConference

http://www.gdconf.com/

title: ► WTF Is... - Antichamber (Hyper WTF is? edition)
description:
http://bit.ly/XhMQek - Get Antichamber on Steam on Jan 31st.

TotalBiscuit takes a special look at an earlier version of the puzzle-game Antichamber, accompanied by its developer. This was filmed at PAX last year and I held onto it at the request of the developer to put out close to the games release. This does not necessarily reflect the final product, though that's a good thing since it avoids some spoilers and the commentary is what's interesting.

Game Description:

Antichamber is a mind-bending psychological exploration game where nothing can be taken for granted. Discover an Escher-like world where hallways wrap around upon each other, spaces reconfigure themselves, and accomplishing the impossible may just be the only way forward.

Several years in the making, Antichamber received over 25 awards and honors throughout its development, in major competitions including the Independent Games Festival, the PAX10, IndieCade and Make Something Unreal. Antichamber was also supported by the Indie Fund.

Key Features

A deeply psychological experience that will make you question everything you know about how a game works.

Mind-bending challenges that will subvert your expectations at every twist and turn.

An enormous, seamless non-Euclidean world to explore.

Lifelike soundscapes developed by Robin Arnott and an ambient soundtrack composed by Siddhartha Barnhoorn.

A gun that can create, destroy and manipulate matter, allowing you to discover new ways to overcome your surroundings.

Reviews

“Even as the developer told me what the game was doing to mess with my brain while I was playing it, it still succeeded in messing with my brain.”
– Rock, Paper, Shotgun

“The most tenacious, infuriating obstacle you’ll face throughout the game is yourself.”
– PC Gamer

“Every aspect of Antichamber is made to get players out of their comfort zone.”
– VentureBeat

title: Oculus Rift DK2 - Antichamber - Mind Bending
description:
We take a look at Antichamber on the Oculus Rift DK2 on vorpX settings below!

Antichamber is a mind-bending psychological exploration game where nothing can be taken for granted. Discover an Escher-like world where hallways wrap around upon each other, spaces reconfigure themselves, and accomplishing the impossible may just be the only way forward.

Fullscreen Windowed Mode - DirectX 11Beta
Start on Main Monitor then use shortcut WINDOWS KEY, SHIFT & ARROW KEY LEFT to move to the Rift.

If vorpX does not hook the game, quit out, pause the watcher (right click vorpX in the bottom right) and then resume the watcher.

1920 x 1080 - 75hz Refresh Rate
V-Sync OFF

Antichamber - http://www.antichamber-game.com
Oculus Rift - http://www.oculus.com
vorpX - http://www.vorpx.com

vorpX Settings
Z-Adaptive Mode
Letterbox 1
IPD 63.1mm - That is just for my eyes! (Move till it looks good)
Headtracking sensitivity 1.10
Headtracking Smooth None
Fix Chromatic Aberration - ON


Other Settings - Catalyst Control Center 
Contrast - 70
Saturation - 140
Hue - 6
Brightness - 40 - 50

See Oculus Rift Setup Guides
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tjUO0s0jLqg - Basics
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YmZPDZFWzv0 -Advanced
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WFND8-bWVZI - Refresh Rates

System Spec

16GB 2400mhz Ram DDR3 Corsair Pro Vengeance 4x4GB
AMD Radeon R9 290X 4GB - @ GPU 1120 & Mem 1450

title: Antichamber Teaser - January 31st, 2013 on Steam
description:
Official Website: http://www.antichamber-game.com
Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/Antichamber
Twitter: http://twitter.com/Antichamber

Antichamber is a game about discovery, set inside a vibrant, minimal, Escher-like world, where geometry and space follow unfamiliar rules, and obstacles are a matter of perception.

Journey through the depths of a non-Euclidean labyrinth, as you create, destroy and manipulate matter, and uncover new ways to overcome your surroundings in this mind-bending psychological exploration game.

Coming to Steam on January 31st, 2013

title: PC Longplay [335] Antichamber
description:
http://www.longplays.org

Played by: johtto

**WARNING, DO NOT WATCH IF YOU PLAN ON PLAYING THIS GAME YOURSELF. IT WILL RUIN THE GAME.**


This is a longplay for the PC game Antichamber!

Where do I even begin? This game is completely mind boggling. 

Antichamber features many puzzles all of which have their own ways to really make you think.

My experience when I had first played it was really, fantastic. I didn't know what I was geting into and by the time I had conquered each puzzle I knew I had to make a longplay of it.

If you liked the longplay, check out my personal channel : http://www.youtube.com/user/xWickedHDx
Thanks for Watching the Longplay, any mistakes, pauses, or weird glitches I missed in the longplay I apologize for.

title: Antichamber :: Live SPEED RUN by Marche Fighter Paladin #AGDQ 2014
description:
Please leave a 'Like' to show us which runs you enjoy most. Run starts at 06:27. #129, played by Marche Fighter Paladin (
Time 0:08:59
 2014 SDA 
Couch commentators: Zephyrz (http://www.twitch.tv/Zephyrz), ubergoose (http://www.twitch.tv/ubergoos) (http://www.youtube.com/user/UberGusMage) (https://twitter.com/ubergooseus), and testrunner (http://www.twitch.tv/testrunner) (https://twitter.com/Test_Runner)

Antichamber (originally known as Hazard: The Journey of Life)[2] is a single-player first-person puzzle-platform video game developed by Alexander Bruce. Many of the puzzles are based on phenomena that occur within the Non-Euclidean geometry created by the game engine, such as passages that lead the player to different locations depending on which way they face, and structures that seem otherwise impossible within normal three-dimensional space. Source: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Antichamber

At this past Awesome Games Done Quick, $1,025,000 was raised for the Prevent Cancer Foundation. It only took a week of continuous streaming, 18,000 donors, and many many runners to achieve. A big thanks to everyone responsible for these amazing numbers, what a humbling achievement. For comparison, last year's event raised just under $500,000.

Buy Antichamber on Steam: http://store.steampowered.com/app/219890/

Game Description:

Antichamber is a mind-bending psychological exploration game where nothing can be taken for granted. Discover an Escher-like world where hallways wrap around upon each other, spaces reconfigure themselves, and accomplishing the impossible may just be the only way forward.

Several years in the making, Antichamber received over 25 awards and honors throughout its development, in major competitions including the Independent Games Festival, the PAX10, IndieCade and Make Something Unreal. Antichamber was also supported by the Indie Fund.

Key Features

A deeply psychological experience that will make you question everything you know about how a game works.

Mind-bending challenges that will subvert your expectations at every twist and turn.

An enormous, seamless non-Euclidean world to explore.

Lifelike soundscapes developed by Robin Arnott and an ambient soundtrack composed by Siddhartha Barnhoorn.

A gun that can create, destroy and manipulate matter, allowing you to discover new ways to overcome your surroundings.

Reviews

“Even as the developer told me what the game was doing to mess with my brain while I was playing it, it still succeeded in messing with my brain.”
– Rock, Paper, Shotgun

“The most tenacious, infuriating obstacle you’ll face throughout the game is yourself.”
– PC Gamer

“Every aspect of Antichamber is made to get players out of their comfort zone.”
– VentureBeat

title: Antichamber - 100% ~55 minutes speedrun
description:
This is a really old video from when the game was new. The current world record for the 100% category is under 20 minutes: https://www.speedrun.com/Antichamber#100

I didn't get all the purple cubes. This is only my fifth time playing the game and my third attempt at a speedrun. This is definitely not the best and there are a lot of mistakes, but I'm very happy that I was able to get below 1 hour. The video is unedited; FRAPS recorded to an AVI at 40fps and then I used VLC to convert it to MP4 for compression, then I uploaded it straight to YouTube. This is not 'official' by any means. I did make use of glitches in this version of the game.

This video is also on Twitch: https://www.twitch.tv/lb___/v/96401564

title: Let’s Play Antichamber #10: Ascending the Tower
description:
This is a blind playthrough. Kindly avoid posting spoilers in the comments or solutions to puzzles either in this video or future ones so as not to spoil the experience for me or those that haven’t seen the game before.

Some people watch the videos for this game and lament that I don’t cut out or accelerate the time spent figuring out and solving the puzzles. For me, the joy of puzzle solving is the process itself, working out what the game wants from you and then making it happen with the tools you have available. For games such as this, the journey is far more important than the destination and if you focus only on reaching the end goal, you’ll miss all the amazing experiences along the way. Additionally, cutting out or condensing the puzzling pondering part of the game will prevent me from showing what the game is actually like, something I consider very important with my content.

That aside, we’ve finally gotten past the seemingly impossible puzzle which has brought us to another place with more puzzles yet. Slowly we’re whittling down the avenues we can progress down, for some require a tool that we don’t yet possess: the red thingy. Whatever power it possesses must be fantastic indeed which makes me hope that I’ll get hold of it soon.

Twitter: https://twitter.com/Kikoskia
Patreon: https://www.patreon.com/kikoskia

title: Antichamber: Secret #2 - Over The Edge
description:
Some people are having issues with game crashing when drawing cubes or other dense objects. Game's developer is aware of that and is working on a fix. http://steamcommunity.com/app/219890/discussions/0/864958451425168004/

As I continued exploring, Ifound another place I missed earlier. I guess I fell in to the hole and just continued playing. Secret isn't as interesting as the earlier one, but puzzle to get the door open sure was a harder one. Though it only took me a minute or two to come up with the solution. I wonder if that room still holds something to find...

More secrets: http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL5LLbajXGCYaXH7OzDh-v1OQfNn4xAgL7

title: Let's Play Antichamber - PC Gameplay Part 1 - Every Journey Is A Series Of Choices
description:
Antichamber is a mind-bending psychological exploration game where nothing can be taken for granted. Discover an Escher-like world where hallways wrap around upon each other, spaces reconfigure themselves, and accomplishing the impossible may just be the only way forward.

Key Features
A deeply psychological experience that will make you question everything you know about how a game works.
Mind-bending challenges that will subvert your expectations at every twist and turn.
An enormous, seamless non-Euclidean world to explore.
Lifelike soundscapes developed by Robin Arnott and an ambient soundtrack composed by Siddhartha Barnhoorn.
A gun that can create, destroy and manipulate matter, allowing you to discover new ways to overcome your surroundings.

Get Antichamber on Steam: https://store.steampowered.com/app/219890/Antichamber/
_

Outro Music: Braincooler - Mega Man X Chill Penguin Stage Remix By Rozovian - https://ocremix.org/remix/OCR01916

title: Let's Play Antichamber Part 3 - Under the Elevator (Patreon Chosen Game)
description:
Watch more Antichamber! https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL5dr1EHvfwpO0Vnhkm5u2vNGuMsuQaDSr

Support what I do by subscribing on Patreon! https://www.patreon.com/SebastianSB

My Twitter: https://twitter.com/SebastianSB

Twitch (streaming): http://www.twitch.tv/sebastiansb

Buy Antichamber on Steam: http://store.steampowered.com/app/219890/

Game Description:

Antichamber is a mind-bending psychological exploration game where nothing can be taken for granted. Discover an Escher-like world where hallways wrap around upon each other, spaces reconfigure themselves, and accomplishing the impossible may just be the only way forward.

Several years in the making, Antichamber received over 25 awards and honors throughout its development, in major competitions including the Independent Games Festival, the PAX10, IndieCade and Make Something Unreal. Antichamber was also supported by the Indie Fund.

Key Features

A deeply psychological experience that will make you question everything you know about how a game works.

Mind-bending challenges that will subvert your expectations at every twist and turn.

An enormous, seamless non-Euclidean world to explore.

Lifelike soundscapes developed by Robin Arnott and an ambient soundtrack composed by Siddhartha Barnhoorn.

A gun that can create, destroy and manipulate matter, allowing you to discover new ways to overcome your surroundings.

Reviews

“Even as the developer told me what the game was doing to mess with my brain while I was playing it, it still succeeded in messing with my brain.”
– Rock, Paper, Shotgun

“The most tenacious, infuriating obstacle you’ll face throughout the game is yourself.”
– PC Gamer

“Every aspect of Antichamber is made to get players out of their comfort zone.”
– VentureBeat

title: Antichamber PC Gameplay Opinions and First Impressions Review First 30 Minutes of Antichamber
description:
http://www.redgamingtech.com for more gaming news, reviews & tech
http://www.facebook.com/redgamingtech - Follow us on Facebook!

In this video I (CrimsonRayne) take a look at Antichamber for the PC - this title has been called "portal on LSD" by some, and I can understand where they are coming from.

Antichamber is a puzzle and adventure title, developed using UDK (Unreal Development Kit). It is a surreal mix of gameplay and visual puzzles, with calming music throughout the weirdness of the areas.

Unlike some games, Antichamber isn't afraid to make you explore, and backtrack a lot. Backtracking in antichamber changes the layout of locations, or even leads back to entirely different rooms.

Antichamber isn't for everyone, but it is safe to say that if you are a fan of Valve's portal series, you are likely to find a great game here. The game features in-game narration through 'screens' in the game, which serve as both guide, hints and narration of sorts. The goal is fairly simple, to make progression through the game in a decent time - and more to the point, to solve the various puzzles.

AntiChamber's visuals are impressive, with a heavy emphasis on angle of view and with excellent animations - for example, on platforms that only appear when you walk on them, and then drop away the moment you jump. 

Overall I really enjoyed my time with the title, and would highly encourage others to check the game out!

title: Antichamber - Creating a cube around me (and crashing the game)
description:
WARNING: May contain spoilers.

I was playing Antichamber and was wondering if you could make a Cube by joining squares.

I also wondered what would happen if I was inside the Cube while it was being filled.
